(301) 530-6788
Margit Hamosh, Ph. D. 9410 Balfour Court Bethesda, Maryland 20014
CURRICULUM VITAE
Born: August 13, 1933. Married, three children, U. S. citizen.
Professional Information
1979-date
Associate Professor, Department of Pediatrics, Georgetown University School of Medicine
1980-date
Associate Professor, Faculty for Graduate Studies and Research, University of Maryland (Associate Membership)
1976-1979
Research Associate, Department of Physiology and Biophysics, Georgetown University School of Medicine
1974-1976
Assistant Professor, Department of Anatomy, Georgetown University School of Medicine
1967-1974
Visiting Scientist, National Institute of Arthritis, Metabolism and Digestive Diseases, Section of Endocrinology, NIH
1965-1967
Sabbatical leave, visiting scientist at National Institute of Mental Health, Section of General and Comparative Biochemistry, NIH
1964-1965
Assistant Professor in Biochemistry, Hebrew University, Hadassah Medical School
1961-1964
Instructor in Biochemistry, Hebrew University, Hadassah Medical School
1959-1961
Post Doctoral fellow in Biochemistry, Hebrew University, Hadassah Medical School
1959
Awarded Ph. D. Degree by the Hebrew University, Hadassah Medical School, Thesis subject: Effect of bacterial endotoxin on carbohydrate metabolism, Summa cum laude
1956-1959
Graduate fellow in Biochemistry, Hebrew University, Hadassah Medical School
1956
Awarded M. Sc. Degree by the Hebrew University, Hadassah Medical School. Major: microbiology. Minors: biochemistry, parasitology, Summa cum laude
Membership in Professional Organizations
American Physiological Society Society for Experimental Biology and Medicine pays H3 for Back Endocrine Society American Federation for Clinical Research American Thoracic Society New York Academy of Sciences Perinatal Research Society American College of Nutrition
Professional Activities
1980-1984 Member Pulmonary Diseases Advisory Committee, National Heart, Lung and Blood Institute 1981- Member, International Editorial Board, The Journal of Pediatric Gastroenterology and Nutrition
Honors
M. Sc. Summa cum laude, Ph. D. Summa cum laude Fogarty Fellow Listed in American Men and Women of Science Listed in Who is Who in Technology Today
